ai.summary: A gentle 3.6 km out-and-back hike along the Blue Trail at Giant's Causeway, featuring easy terrain, coastal scenery, and seasonal waterfalls. Suitable for families and casual hikers seeking a short, scenic day on the UK coast.
ai.terrain_summary: The route follows a well-maintained mix of gravel paths and occasional wooden boardwalks along the coast. Expect some gentle steps and small rocky patches near overlooks. Surfaces can be slippery when wet, and exposure to wind and spray is common, so warm clothing and sturdy footwear are advised.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather and tide forecasts before you go. Stay on marked paths, keep a safe distance from cliff edges, and be cautious on wet rocks. The area can be windy and visibility can change quickly. Bring enough water, wear waterproof clothing, and keep children under supervision at all times. Mobile service may be limited in remote sections.
recommended_gear: Map or offline navigation (or a charged phone with offline maps)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (April–October) offer mild temperatures and more visible waterfalls; winter can be cold, wet, and darker, with higher risk of slips.
